item.description:
Come meet Boston area Plonistas and learn about Plone!

At this meetup we'll learn more about how Plone is used at Cambridge Interactive Development Corporation.


  • Jeremy Stark will talk about CIDCâ€™s experience with the Plone/Deliverance stack
  • Ricardo Newbery will talk about his work on plone.app.caching - a preview of the talk he will give at the Plone Conference


There will also be an opportunity to informally share our experiences with Plone and discuss the recent release of Plone 4. Refreshments will be served!

Location: CIDC has graciously offered to host this meetup; they are located at 150 CambridgePark Drive in Cambridge, very near the Alewife T station. Building access is restricted but someone will be stationed at the door to let you in. If you arrive late please call 978-502-6398 and we'll come get you.

Note: We are moving our meetup to a quarterly (instead of monthly) schedule. To avoid various conflicts the new dates will be second Thursdays starting in October - so that's October 14, January 13, April 14, and July 14. Mark your calendars!

About the Meetup: The Boston Plone User Group holds quarterly meetings on the second Thursday of October, January, April, and July. Come, meet, and mingle with your Boston Plone peers. We (users, designers and developers) gather monthly to talk about how we're using Plone, share knowledge and give demos of cool Plone products.

About Plone: Plone is among the top 2% of all open source projects worldwide, with 200 core developers and more than 300 solution providers in 57 countries. The project has been actively developed since 2001, is available in more than 40 languages, and has the best security track record of any major CMS. Find out more at plone.org.
item.name: The Boston Plone Fall Meetup
